channel.title: Dark Side of Steve Jobs
channel.description:
I think this is a worth giving a read, I've found that the more and more I discover about Jobs after his death the less I've come to respect him. The guy was a genius dick.
http://pando.com/2014/02/19/court-documents-reveal-steve-jobs-blistering-threat-to-ceo-who-wouldnt-join-wage-fixing-cartel/?utm_source=PandoDigest&utm_campaign=65a8bce43f-PandoDigest_December_9_2013_copy_09_12_11_2013&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_2f01c2729e-65a8bce43f-81009317

item.title: Dark Side of Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

Most people who are in a position to change the world are dicks. They put in an extreme amount of time to achieve things just for people to leech.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Side of Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

xEthanx:

@Pure - Of course he isn’t the first, but he is a lot more severe than the rest, plus the entire nation doesn’t praise CEOs as if they’re the next Edison like they do Jobs. There aren’t a lot of CEOs right now making illegal threats in a subtle way to other companies.

Speaking of dicks, Edison was another massive one.

Edison and Jobs are quite alike, both were massive dicks, neither invented anything new (barring some small stuff) but rather improved or stole prior technologies, and were at the right time in the right place to achieve marketing success.

Rodgerwilco:

Most people who are in a position to change the world are dicks. They put in an extreme amount of time to achieve things just for people to leech.

If they’re trying to change the world and are jaded because “people are leeches”, they’re not good people and their motives aren’t pure or aren’t to change the world, for you know, the greater good. There are plenty of people who have changed the world for the greater good and are humble about it, because you know, they aren’t assholes. One such example would be Norman Borlaug, who is credited for saving a billion lives. Billion, with a B.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Side of Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Davidi2:

The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore

That was too good, made my day.

Honestly, people do things for specific reasons and if you don’t hear their side of the story then how do you really know what is going on. I never really knew who steve jobs was so i couldn’t care less about his achievements now.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Side of Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @xEthanx xEthanx
item.description:
@xEthanx wrote:

Ambokile:

http://appleinsider.com/articles/09/07/21/worker_commits_suicide_after_iphone_prototype_goes_missing_reports

Interesting article, more-so than mine actually. It just shows how fucked up big companies can be behind closed doors, and that Steve Jobs was a lot worse than most I’ve seen… at least from what we can see.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Side of Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:2, topic:540471”]The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore[/quote]rep ++ Dumbles/Steve Jobs does sound like a very good example similarity.

Why did harry have to stay with parents who would abuse him and was abused, and continued to get abused for so long?
Why did steve jobs threaten others, people knew about it and didn’t do anything?

Typical

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Side of Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

Of course.
Wozniak was the tech genius and Jobs was just super good at marketing.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Side of Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @xEthanx xEthanx
item.description:
@xEthanx wrote:

@All - I never said that he was ineffective or unsuccessful. Of course he’s one of the greatest innovators of our time. That’s irrelevant to what I’m trying to get at, which was he was incredibly callous and crude to others. I’m just questioning if it’s right to imbue him with Messiah-like properties like a lot tend to do.

@Pure - Of course he isn’t the first, but he is a lot more severe than the rest, plus the entire nation doesn’t praise CEOs as if they’re the next Edison like they do Jobs. There aren’t a lot of CEOs right now making illegal threats in a subtle way to other companies.

@Lothy - Sure, looks interesting, I’ll give it a look.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Side of Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

He was a dick. With that said though, I’d rather be a successful dick than an unsuccessful good guy.

The film Pirates of Silicon Valley is worth a watch if you’re interested in the history of Microsoft and Apple.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Side of Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Seems like this thread is being treated seriously, you all do realize this is something not only Jobs has done? I’d argue that many before and after him will continue to do the same (as are his co-conspirators since I doubt anybody forced them into it). It’s called effective marketing (and to an extent monopolizing their trade), whether ethical or not is not their concern - profit is.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Side of Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:6, topic:540471”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=659332.msg4409411#msg4409411 date=1393045708]
If you aren’t an asshole then nothing will get done, his methods were effective.
[/quote]
Logical fallacy there (first part)
He didn’t need to be a dick. He could have been just as effective of a leader had he not been.[/quote]

Was joking about the first part.

Read full topic

item.description:

genius* and that’s why I respect him. :- )

Well look there. Typos ftw. I also find it saddening that everyone, or at least people such as you give him a pass on these things.
